v.v: Does not man have hard labor on earth?
Like a slave earnestly desires the shadows of evening,
so I have been made to endure months of misery;
When I lie down, I say to myself,
My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust;
My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle;
God, call to mind that my life is only a breath;
The eye of God, who sees me, will see me no more;
As a cloud is consumed and vanishes away,
He will return no more to his house;

v: Are not his days like the days of a hired man?
like a hired man looks for his wages—
I have been given trouble-filled nights.
‘When will I get up and when will the night be gone?’
I am full of tossing to and fro until the day’s dawning.
the sores in my skin harden up and then dissolve and run afresh.
they pass without hope.
my eye will no more see good.
God’s eyes will be on me, but I will not exist.
so he who goes down to Sheol will come up no more.
neither will his place know him again.

v.v: Therefore I will not restrain my mouth;
Am I the sea or a sea monster
When I say, ‘My bed will comfort me,
then you scare me with dreams
so that I would choose strangling
I loathe my life; I would not wish to always be alive;
What is man that you should pay attention to him,
that you should observe him every morning
How long will it be before you look away from me,
Even if I have sinned, what would that do to you, you who watch men?
Why do you not pardon my transgression and take away my iniquity?

v: I will speak in the anguish of my spirit;
I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
that you place a guard over me?
and my couch will ease my complaint,’
and terrify me through visions,
and death rather than preserving these bones of mine.
let me alone for my days are useless.
that you should set your mind on him,
and test him every moment?
before you let me alone long enough for me to swallow down my own saliva?
Why have you made a target of me,
so that I am a burden for you?
For now will I lie down in the dust;
you will seek me carefully, but I will not exist.”
